business.headline: Sai Life Sciences shares debut at 18% premium on stock exchanges Sai Life Sciences listing: Sai Life Sciences shares made a strong debut on Wednesday, listing at a premium of 18% on the NSE, with the stock opening at Rs 650, which is Rs 101 above its issue price.

Bumper debut for Mobikwik shares as stocks list at 59% premium on Dalal StreetMobikwik listing: The shares of One Mobikwik Systems debuted on the BSE at Rs 442.25, marking a 58.51% premium over the issue price of Rs 279.
Vishal Mega Mart shares make strong market debut at 33% premium on D-Street Vishal Mega Mart share price: The stock began trading at Rs 104, at a premium of 33% over its issue price of Rs 78.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as cautious investors weigh global trendsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 15.56 points to 80,668.89, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 4 points to 24,332.00.

Facebook owner Meta hit with 251 million euros in fines for 2018 data breachIreland's Data Protection Commission issued the penalties to Meta after wrapping up its inquiry into the breach, when hackers gained access to user accounts by exploiting bugs in the platform's code.

Cryptocurrencies to be taxed as capital gains: Relief for pre-FY23 earningsThe Income Tax Appellate Tribunal (ITAT) decision defines cryptocurrencies as capital assets, distinguishing pre-2022 profits as capital gains and applying a 30% flat tax to post-2022 transactions.

Income Tax Department admits error of sending wrong ITR notices. Check details The Income Tax Department has acknowledged its mistake in sending defective ITR notices, offering relief to many, though taxpayers who filed revised returns could face complications.

Will India's economic growth pick up pace? Nirmala Sitharaman answersFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman acknowledged that July to September was a challenging period for the economy but called the slowdown a 'temporary blip'.

Dormant account? Here's how to easily reactivate it at SBI, PNB and 2 more banksKeep your bank account active with periodic transactions and KYC updates. Reactivate dormant accounts at HDFC, PNB, SBI, and IDFC FIRST Banks with simple steps.

Sensex plunges over 1,000 points as bearish sentiment grips marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 1064.12 points to end the day at 80,684.45, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 332.25 points to close at 24,336.00.
EPFO members may soon approve their own PF withdrawals: ReportCurrently, withdrawing PF funds involves multiple checks and balances, with subscribers required to submit forms and wait for approvals.
EPFO high pension: Why have 1.7 million applied for higher EPS contribution?Launched in 1995, the Employees' Pension Scheme (EPS-95) offers social security to organised sector employees.

ITC shares rise as ITC Hotels demerger set for January 1, 2025: Key detailsITC Hotels demerger announcement came after the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT), Kolkata Bench, approved the scheme of arrangement between ITC and ITC Hotels.

How big corporates are choking middle class, hurting India growth storyThe government gave tax relief to private companies in 2019 hoping they would invest in people and infrastructure. It was counterproductive. Big corporates pocketed profits and froze real wages of employees. Here's why the government should take a decisive step to ensure more money in the hands of the middle class to boost India's growth story.
Traffic challans in Delhi? Know how to get them waived off starting December 20Delhi Police launches Evening Court sessions from December 20 to clear pending traffic fines.

Dam Capital IPO: Check opening date, price band, gmp, issue details  DAM Capital Advisors' IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 840.25 crore. The entire issue is an offer for sale (OFS) of 2.97 crore shares by the selling shareholders.

Concord Enviro IPO opening date: Check GMP, price band, other detailsThe Concord Enviro IPO is a book-built issue of Rs 500.33 crore. It includes a fresh issue of 0.25 crore shares, which will raise Rs 175 crore, and an offer for sale (OFS) of 0.46 crore shares worth Rs 325.33 crore.

Sensex falls nearly 1,000 points: 3 key factors for the market crash todayShare market today: The S&P BSE Sensex fell by over 900 points to hit an intra-day low of 80,941.61, while theNSE Nifty50 dropped 247.75 points to reach its lowest point of the day at 24,420.5.

International Gemmological Institute IPO: Check latest GMP, subscription status International Gemmological Institute IPO update: The International Gemmological IPO was fully booked on its final day of bidding.

Vishal Mega Mart share listing date: GMP jumps? Check if you got sharesVishal Mega Mart market debut: Investors who applied for the Rs 8,000 core IPO will receive alerts, messages, or emails regarding the allotment, or any revocations of their IPO mandate, by Tuesday, December 17.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Nitin Gadkari, 19 BJP MPs skip One Nation One Poll session, may get notice: SourcesThe party had issued a three-line whip mandating all MPs to be present in the House for the session. Despite the backlash, the Bill secured 269 votes in favour, while 198 MPs voted against it following a 90-minute debate and a division of votes.

If they tax us, we tax them: Trump warns India over tariffs on US goodsDonald Trump warned that if India continues to impose high tariffs on US goods, his administration would respond with reciprocal tariffs. He emphasised that trade should be fair, and any tax imposed on the US would be met with the same treatment.

Your Constitution amendments vs ours: Amit Shah rips into CongressReplying to the debate on the Constitution in Rajya Sabha, Amit Shah compared BJP and Congress on Constitutional amendments, highlighting BJP's 22 modifications in 16 years versus Congress's 77 in 55 years.

Starlink devices made by Elon Musk's SpaceX seized from Manipur outfit: SourcesAccording to security officials, the recovery of the Starlink devices has prompted relevant agencies to investigate how the equipment found its way to the strife-torn state.

Has the hangman's noose helped China curb big scams?China on Tuesday executed a former Communist party official who was convicted in a $421-million financial scam. China often hands down death sentences and tough jail terms in big corruption cases. Has the hangman's noose actually helped China bring down cases of corruption and the magnitude of scams?

Virat Kohli helps Rohit Sharma, Mohammed Siraj plot Steve Smith's downfallVirat Kohli played the role of the mastermind as the Indian star helped captain Rohit Sharma and Mohammed Siraj get the wicket of Steve Smith on Day 5 of the Gabba Test. Smith was once again caught down the leg side.

Go Trudeau go, calls grow, Canada PM's job hangs by a threadCanadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, who is facing a tough election test in 2025, is also seeing intense calls to resign. His popularity, too, is at an all-time low. This is why the job of the highly unpopular PM might be hanging by a thread.

China ready to work with India, says Beijing ahead of Ajit Doval-Wang Yi meetChinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Lin Jian stated that China is ready to work with India to implement the common understandings reached between the two countries' leaders. He emphasised that China is committed to respecting each other's core interests and concerns, strengthening mutual trust through dialogue.

UK professor calls out low academic salaries, says Indian universities pay moreIn a post on X, a UK-based professor called out UK universities' low academic salaries particularly offered to contractual staff, and said that Indian universities pay more.

3rd Test Day 5 Live: Tea taken early after bad light halts India's 275 chaseIndia (IND) vs Australia (AUS), 3rd Test Day 5 Live and Reactions: Early tea has been taken after bad light stopped play. Dark clouds are hanging over the Gabba. After going 89/7, Australia decided to declare, setting a 275-run target for India to win. India's pacers rattled Australia. Jasprit Bumrah led the show with three wickets while Akash Deep and Mohammed Siraj chipped in with 2 wickets each.

Sambhal riots accused Samajwadi MP moves High Court: Ruling party vengefulIn his petition before the Allahabad High Court, Zia-ur-Rehman Barq claimed that the charges against him were politically motivated and denied any connection to the Sambhal violence, which left five people dead.

Boy injured in Pushpa 2 screening stampede on ventilator support, criticalThe nine-year-old boy, who was injured during the December 4 stampede at Sandhya Theatre after Pushpa 2 screening, remained critical and on ventilator support. The doctors said his path to recovery would be a prolonged one.

Can microdosing on Ozempic help you lose weight without any side effects? Microdosing Ozempic has gained momentum online, with people hoping to use the weight-loss benefits while dodging the side effects.

Why cabinet tightrope will test Mahayuti's balanceWith powerful aspirants left out of the 39-member cabinet, inducted after weeks of jockeying for posts, the discontent is as palpable as the pressure on ministers to perform or perish

Gabba Test: Bumrah breaks Kapil Dev's all-time record for India in AustraliaJasprit Bumrah has broken Kapil Dev's record in Australia as he dismissed Usman Khawaja and Marnus Labuschagne on Day 5 of the Gabba Test. Bumrah has continued to be India's best player in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

Delhi air quality remains 'severe', thick blanket of smog reduces visibilityDelhi weather: Of Delhi's 37 monitoring stations, 32 of them had AQI readings beyond the 400-mark, with the worst affected areas being Anand Vihar, Burari and Lajpat Nagar with AQI above 480.

India sets up its first diabetes biobank. Why it mattersIndia has set up its first diabetes biobank in Chennai. This partnership between the Indian Council of Medical Research and the Madras Diabetes Research Foundation, aims to enhance research by providing access to a vast repository of biological samples.

Am I a toy?: NCP's Chhagan Bhujbal jabs Ajit Pawar after Maharashtra cabinet snubSenior NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal publicly expressed his displeasure over his exclusion from the Maharashtra cabinet and alleged that he felt humiliated by party chief Ajit Pawar's treatment.

Rahul Gandhi's 'manusmriti' jibe after Amit Shah's 'Ambedkar, Ambedkar' remarkCongress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge hit out at Union Home Minister Amit Shah over the remarks he made about BR Ambedkar in Rajya Sabha on Tuesday.

High Court judge appears before Supreme Court over 'majority' remark: SourcesThe judge, who reportedly made statements endorsing the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) and allegedly commented on the Muslim community, appeared before the Supreme Court collegium on Tuesday to clarify his position.

Hansal Mehta slams Film Federation's 'wrong choice' after Laapataa Ladies Oscars snubHansal Mehta and Ricky Kej criticised the Film Federation of India for selecting Laapataa Ladies as India's Oscars entry. The Kiran Rao-directed film failed to make it to the shortlist for the Best International Feature category at the 97th Academy Awards.

Mysore Sandal Soap makers pay historic Rs 108.62 crore dividend to SiddaramaiahKarnataka Soaps and Detergents Limited (KSDL), the maker of Mysore Sandal Soap, presents a record Rs 108.62 crore dividend to Chief Minister Siddaramaiah. The amount marks the highest dividend payout in the company's history

India's Laapataa Ladies out of Oscar race, Guneet Monga's Anuja shortlistedKiran Rao and Aamir Khan's Laapataa Ladies did not make the cut in International Feature Film category as The Academy announced shortlists in 10 categories. Guneet Monga's live-action short, Anuja, made the cut.

Gabba Test: Why India were right in celebrating follow-on escape momentThe Indian dressing room broke into celebrations after the team avoided a follow-on on Day 4 of the Gabba Test against Australia. The jubilation drew mixed reactions from fans on social media, a section arguing that the team had gotten so bad that they were celebrating avoiding a follow-on.

Taimur is reserved, Jeh is all over the place: Sharmila Tagore on grandchildrenSharmila Tagore discussed the unique traits of her grandsons, Taimur and Jeh, and shared a parenting lesson from Saif's childhood. She will next star in Outhouse, releasing on December 20.

Yami Gautam-Aditya Dhar and son, Sanjay Dutt seek blessings at Golden templeYami Gautam, along with husband Aditya Dhar and son, Vedavid, visited the Golden Temple in Amritsar. They were also joined by Sanjay Dutt.

Pushpa 2 box office Day 13: Allu Arjun's film remains unstoppablePushpa 2 box office collection Day 13: Allu Arjun and director Sukumar's Pushpa 2: The Rule is enjoying a phenomenal run in theatres. The film is all set to enter Rs 1,500 crore worldwide.

The Kiran Rao-directed film failed to make it to the shortlist for the Best International Feature category at the 97th Academy Awards.

Gukesh will pick and choose tournaments, focus on defending world title: FatherChess World Championship: Speaking to India Today, D Gukesh's father Rajinikanth said the youngest world champion will pick and choose his tournaments next year and work towards defending his world championship title. Rajinikanth acknowledged Tamil Nadu government's support to help the sport grow in the state.

Stand at Eden Gardens named after Jhulan: 'It will motivate young cricketers' Legendary fast bowler Jhulan Goswami expressed her honour at the Cricket Association of Bengal's gesture to rename a stand at the iconic Eden Gardens after her. The former India cricketer added that the stand would inspire many young women cricketers

Samson snubbed from Kerala's Vijay Hazare Trophy squad, Nizar to leadSanju Samson's exclusion from Kerala's Vijay Hazare Trophy squad raised questions, especially after his impactful Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy performances. Salman Nizar's appointment as captain set the tone for Kerala's revamped 19-member lineup for the tournament.

Salman Agha shares Player Of The Match award with Saim Ayub after 1st ODI winSalman Agha won the hearts of the fans as the Pakistan vice-captain decided to share his Player Of The Match award with Saim Ayub after Pakistan's thrilling win over South Africa on Tuesday, December 17. Ayub and Aga

Harbhajan Singh had a funny take on the episode.

Watch: Akash Deep's innocent banter with Travis Head in Gabba TestA tense exchange between Akash Deep and Travis Head on Day 5 of the Brisbane Test added to the drama, as India's lower order defied Australia's attack to narrow the deficit and keep the contest alive.

Gabba Test: Lightning stops play on Day 5, ICC's '30-30' rule explainedThe 3rd Test between India and Australia at the Gabba faced an unexpected halt on Day 5 due to lightning. Here's a look at the ICC's '30-30 rule' which makes the umpires call off play when there is a lightning threat.

Amidst Manchester United exit talk, Marcus Rashford ready for 'new challenge'Manchester United's Marcus Rashford has sparked speculation about his future, hinting at a desire for a new challenge. Rashford has struggled to make an impact this season for the Red Devils.

Vinicius Jr named FIFA Best of 2024 after Ballon d'Or snub to RodriAfter missing out on the 2024 Ballon d'Or to Rodri, Real Madrid winger Vinicius Jr was awarded the FIFA Best 2024 for his stellar season with Los Blancos. Bonmati retained her FIFA Best Women's Player player award with Alejandro Garnacho winning the Puskas.

SA vs PAK: Agha-Ayub brilliance helps Pakistan clinch thrilling win in 1st ODISaim Ayub's incredible hundred and Salman Agha's all-round performance helped Pakistan secure a thrilling win in the first ODI. Ayub and Agha's partnership helped Pakistan secure the 3-wicket win in the end.

Mitchell Santner replaces Kane Williamson as new New Zealand white-ball captainNew Zealand have announced that Mitchell Santner will be taking over from Kane Williamson as the new white-ball captain of the side. Santner will begin his captaincy with the upcoming T20I series against Sri Lanka.

We are leaving one of the greats behind: Tom Latham on Tim Southee's retirementTim Southee's retirement marks the end of a stellar 17-year Test career.  Captain Tom Latham hailed him as a team great with a lasting legacy on and off the field.

Sundar Pichai, Elon Musk react to Jasprit Bumrah's viral 'batting' commentSundar Pichai reacted to Jasprit Bumrah's six off Pat Cummins' delivery on Day 4 of the 3rd Test between India and Australia at The Gabba. This also prompted a reaction from Tesla CEO Elon Musk.

Sourav Ganguly back Virat Kohli to score 1 more hundred vs AustraliaFormer India skipper Sourav Ganguly has backed Virat Kohli to hit one more hundred in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Ganguly has also commented on Rohit Sharma's rut in the middle order.

DDCA President Rohan Jaitley shares his vision for the future of Delhi cricketRohan Jaitley's re-election as DDCA President marks a renewed focus on grassroot-level cricket, high-performance centres, and inclusivity, ensuring young talent thrives. With fresh leadership and ambitious plans, Delhi cricket looks set for a promising future under his vision.

India set to host World Boxing Final in November 2025India is set to host the prestigious World Boxing Cup Final in November 2025, cementing its support for the breakaway World Boxing (WB) organisation. This major sporting event will be held under the aegis of the Boxing Federation of India (BFI).

Zakir Hussain: The tabla maestro who almost played cricketRenowned tabla maestro Ustad Zakir Hussain passed away on December 15, 2024 at the age of 73. Here's the story of how cricket dominated Zakir's dreams in his childhood.

Harbhajan Singh confident of India saving Gabba Test. Here's whyHarbhajan Singh is confident that India will draw the Test match at Gabba. Speaking after Day 4, the former spinner argued that the Australian bowlers simply do not have enough strength to bundle out India in the second innings.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
